intro: Androsace forrestiana, commonly known as the Himalayan rock moss, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the alpine regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, fleshy leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. Its flowers are typically pink or white, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Androsace forrestiana thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments.
